intro: Urophyllum maingayi, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Bignoniaceae and is characterized by its striking orange-red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces long, pendulous fruit pods that split open to release seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adaptable to various soil types. Urophyllum maingayi is also valued for its ability to thrive in full sun and its resilience to drought conditions.
